<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Dual Thrower](/Feats.aspx?ID=6308) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 196 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Dual-Weapon Warrior](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=247)

**Prerequisites**
[Dual-Weapon Warrior Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6307)

</column>

---

You know how to throw two weapons as easily as strike with them. Whenever a feat you gained from the dual-weapon warrior archetype allows you to make a melee Strike, you can instead make a ranged Strike with a [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=711) weapon or a one-handed ranged weapon you are wielding (weapons that need “1+” hand, such as [longbows](/Weapons.aspx?ID=436), don't qualify). Any effects from these feats that apply to one-handed melee weapons or melee Strikes also apply to one-handed ranged weapons and ranged Strikes.
name: Dual Thrower
